Facility.description: Arecibo Observatory is an educational facility funded by the National Science Foundation and called Arecibo C3 (Arecibo Center for Culturally Relevant and Inclusive Science Education, Computational Skills, and Community Engagement). From its opening in 1963 to 2016, when the Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical Telescope (FAST) became operational in China, Arecibo's dish made it the world's largest single-aperture radio antenna. In 2020 the antenna was irreparably damaged when its supporting cables failed and the receiving/transmitting equipment fell into the reflecting surface.
